member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.Events.IEventDispatcher
member.summary: Dispatches events from within a scope.

remarks.para: The name of the event is auto-magically discovered by matching the sender type, args type, and eventHandler type. If the match is not unique, then the name parameter must be used to specify the name in an explicit way.
What happens when an event is dispatched depends on the scope settings. It can be anything from "trigger immediately" to "just ignore". Refer to the scope documentation for more details.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.ReadLock
member.summary: Provides a convenience methodology for implementing locked access to resources.

remarks.para: Intended as an infrastructure class.

This is a very inefficient way to lock as it allocates one object each time we lock, so it's OK to use this class for things that happen once, where it is convenient, but not for performance-critical code!

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.ReflectionUtilities
member.summary: Provides utilities to simplify reflection.
Provides utilities to simplify reflection.

remarks.para: Readings: * CIL instructions: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_CIL_instructions * ECMA 335: https://www.ecma-international.org/publications/files/ECMA-ST/ECMA-335.pdf * MSIL programming: http://www.blackbeltcoder.com/Articles/net/msil-programming-part-1
Supports emitting constructors, instance and static methods, instance property getters and setters. Does not support static properties yet.

Occurs when does not match the type of the field.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.ReflectionUtilities.EmitConstructor``1(System.Boolean,System.Type)
member.summary: Emits a constructor.
member.param: A value indicating whether the constructor must exist.
The optional type of the class to construct.
member.returns: A constructor function. If is false, returns null when the constructor does not exist.

remarks.para: When is not specified, it is the type returned by .
The constructor arguments are determined by generic arguments.
The type returned by does not need to be exactly , when e.g. that type is not known at compile time, but it has to be a parent type (eg an interface, or object).

member.exception: Occurs when the constructor does not exist and is true.
Occurs when is not a Func or when is specified and does not match the function's returned type.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.ReflectionUtilities.EmitConstructorUnsafe``1(System.Reflection.ConstructorInfo)
member.summary: Emits a constructor.

remarks.para: The constructor is emitted in an unsafe way, using the lambda arguments without verifying them at all. This assumes that the calling code is taking care of all verifications, in order to avoid cast errors.

member.exception: Occurs when is not a Func or when its generic arguments do not match those of .
Occurs when is null.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason
member.summary: Describes the reason for the runtime level.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.Unknown
member.summary: The reason is unknown.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.BootFailedCannotDowngrade
member.summary: The code version is lower than the version indicated in web.config, and downgrading Umbraco is not supported.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.BootFailedCannotConnectToDatabase
member.summary: The runtime cannot connect to the configured database.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.BootFailedCannotCheckUpgradeState
member.summary: The runtime can connect to the configured database, but it cannot retrieve the migrations status.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.BootFailedOnException
member.summary: An exception was thrown during boot.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.InstallNoVersion
member.summary: Umbraco is not installed at all.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.InstallNoDatabase
member.summary: A version is specified in web.config but the database is not configured.
member.remarks: This is a weird state.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.InstallMissingDatabase
member.summary: A version is specified in web.config and a database is configured, but the database is missing, and installing over a missing database has been enabled.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.InstallEmptyDatabase
member.summary: A version is specified in web.config and a database is configured, but the database is empty, and installing over an empty database has been enabled.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.UpgradeOldVersion
member.summary: Umbraco runs an old version.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.UpgradeMigrations
member.summary: Umbraco runs the current version but some migrations have not run.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeLevelReason.Run
member.summary: Umbraco is running.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions
member.summary: Provides static options for the runtime.
member.remarks: These options can be configured in PreApplicationStart or via appSettings.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions.InstallMissingDatabase
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the runtime should enter Install level when the database is missing.

remarks.para: By default, when a database connection string is configured but it is not possible to connect to the database, the runtime enters the BootFailed level. If this options is set to true, it enters the Install level instead.
It is then up to the implementor, that is setting this value, to take over the installation sequence.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions.InstallEmptyDatabase
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the runtime should enter Install level when the database is empty.

remarks.para: By default, when a database connection string is configured and it is possible to connect to the database, but the database is empty, the runtime enters the BootFailed level. If this options is set to true, it enters the Install level instead.
It is then up to the implementor, that is setting this value, to take over the installation sequence.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions.DoRuntimeBoot(Umbraco.Core.Logging.IProfilingLogger)
member.summary: Executes the RuntimeBoot handlers.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions.DoRuntimeEssentials(Umbraco.Core.Composing.Composition,Umbraco.Core.Cache.AppCaches,Umbraco.Core.Composing.TypeLoader,Umbraco.Core.Persistence.IUmbracoDatabaseFactory)
member.summary: Executes the RuntimeEssentials handlers.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions.OnRuntimeBoot(System.Action{Umbraco.Core.Logging.IProfilingLogger})
member.summary: Registers a RuntimeBoot handler.

remarks.para: A RuntimeBoot handler runs when the runtime boots, right after the loggers have been created, but before anything else.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.RuntimeOptions.OnRuntimeEssentials(System.Action{Umbraco.Core.Composing.Composition,Umbraco.Core.Cache.AppCaches,Umbraco.Core.Composing.TypeLoader,Umbraco.Core.Persistence.IUmbracoDatabaseFactory})
member.summary: Registers a RuntimeEssentials handler.

remarks.para: A RuntimeEssentials handler runs after the runtime has created a few essential things (AppCaches, a TypeLoader, and a database factory) but before anything else.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.HashCodeCombiner
member.summary: Used to create a .NET HashCode from multiple objects.
member.remarks:
.Net has a class the same as this: System.Web.Util.HashCodeCombiner and of course it works for all sorts of things which we've not included here as we just need a quick easy class for this in order to create a unique hash of directories/files to see if they have changed.
NOTE: It's probably best to not relying on the hashing result across AppDomains! If you need a constant/reliable hash value between AppDomains use SHA1. This is perfect for hashing things in a very fast way for a single AppDomain.

member.summary: Returns the hex code of the combined hash code

member.summary: Gets a hashcode for a collection for that the order of items does not matter. So {1, 2, 3} and {3, 2, 1} will get same hash code.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.HashCodeHelper.CombineHashCode``1(System.Int32,``0)
member.summary:
Alternative way to get a hashcode is to use a fluent interface like this:
return 0.CombineHashCode(field1).CombineHashCode(field2). CombineHashCode(field3);

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.HashGenerator
member.summary: Used to generate a string hash using crypto libraries over multiple objects
member.remarks: This should be used to generate a reliable hash that survives AppDomain restarts. This will use the crypto libs to generate the hash and will try to ensure that strings, etc... are not re-allocated so it's not consuming much memory.

remarks.para: Does NOT set the property value, so one should probably store the file and then do something alike: property.Value = MediaHelper.FileSystem.GetUrl(filepath).
The original file path is used, in the old media file path scheme, to try and reuse the "folder number" that was assigned to the previous file referenced by the property, if any.

member.summary: Represents a scope context.

member.summary: Enlists an action.
member.param: The optional action priority (default is 100, lower runs first).

remarks.para: It is ok to enlist multiple action with the same key but only the first one will run.
The action boolean parameter indicates whether the scope completed or not.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Scoping.IScopeContext.Enlist``1(System.String,System.Func{``0},System.Action{System.Boolean,``0},System.Int32)
member.summary: Enlists an object and action.
member.param: The optional action priority (default is 100, lower runs first).

remarks.para: On the first time an object is enlisted with a given key, the object is actually created. Next calls just return the existing object. It is ok to enlist multiple objects and action with the same key but only the first one is used, the others are ignored.
The action boolean parameter indicates whether the scope completed or not.

member.summary: Gets an enlisted object.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Scoping.IScopeProvider.CreateScope(System.Data.IsolationLevel,Umbraco.Core.Scoping.RepositoryCacheMode,Umbraco.Core.Events.IEventDispatcher,System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates an ambient scope.
member.param: A value indicating whether to scope the filesystems.
A value indicating whether this scope should always be registered in the call context.
A value indicating whether this scope is auto-completed.

remarks.para: The created scope becomes the ambient scope.
If an ambient scope already exists, it becomes the parent of the created scope.
When the created scope is disposed, the parent scope becomes the ambient scope again.
Parameters must be specified on the outermost scope, or must be compatible with the parents.

Auto-completed scopes should be used for read-only operations ONLY. Do not use them if you do not understand the associated issues, such as the scope being completed even though an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Scoping.IScopeProvider.CreateDetachedScope(System.Data.IsolationLevel,Umbraco.Core.Scoping.RepositoryCacheMode,Umbraco.Core.Events.IEventDispatcher,System.Nullable{System.Boolean})
member.summary: Creates a detached scope.

remarks.para: A detached scope is not ambient and has no parent.
It is meant to be attached by .

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.Serialization.NoTypeConverterJsonConverter`1
member.summary: This is required if we want to force JSON.Net to not use .Net TypeConverters during serialization/deserialization
member.remarks:
In some cases this is required if your model has an explicit type converter, see: http://stackoverflow.com/a/31328131/694494
NOTE: I was going to use this for the ImageCropDataSetConverter to convert to String, which would have worked by putting this attribute: [JsonConverter(typeof(NoTypeConverterJsonConverter{ImageCropDataSet}))] on top of the ImageCropDataSet class, however it turns out we don't require this because to convert to string, we just override ToString(). I'll leave this class here for the future though.

Checks whether a string "haystack" contains within it any of the strings in the "needles" collection and returns true if it does or false if it doesn't
The string to check The collection of strings to check are contained within the first string The type of comparison to perform - defaults to True if any of the needles are contained with haystack; otherwise returns false Added fix to ensure the comparison is used - see http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-11313

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff
member.summary:
This Class implements the Difference Algorithm published in "An O(ND) Difference Algorithm and its Variations" by Eugene Myers Algorithmica Vol. 1 No. 2, 1986, p 251.
The algorithm itself is comparing 2 arrays of numbers so when comparing 2 text documents each line is converted into a (hash) number. See DiffText().
diff.cs: A port of the algorithm to C# Copyright (c) by Matthias Hertel, http://www.mathertel.de This work is licensed under a BSD style license. See http://www.mathertel.de/License.aspx

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffText1(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Find the difference in 2 texts, comparing by text lines. This method uses the DiffInt internally by 1st converting the string into char codes then uses the diff int method
member.param: A-version of the text (usually the old one)
B-version of the text (usually the new one)
member.returns: Returns a array of Items that describe the differences.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffText(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Find the difference in 2 text documents, comparing by text lines. The algorithm itself is comparing 2 arrays of numbers so when comparing 2 text documents each line is converted into a (hash) number. This hash-value is computed by storing all text lines into a common Hashtable so i can find duplicates in there, and generating a new number each time a new text line is inserted.
member.param: A-version of the text (usually the old one)
B-version of the text (usually the new one)
When set to true, all leading and trailing whitespace characters are stripped out before the comparison is done.
When set to true, all whitespace characters are converted to a single space character before the comparison is done.
When set to true, all characters are converted to their lowercase equivalence before the comparison is done.
member.returns: Returns a array of Items that describe the differences.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffCharCodes(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Diffs the char codes.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.Optimize(Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffData)
member.summary: If a sequence of modified lines starts with a line that contains the same content as the line that appends the changes, the difference sequence is modified so that the appended line and not the starting line is marked as modified. This leads to more readable diff sequences when comparing text files.
member.param: A Diff data buffer containing the identified changes.

member.summary: Find the difference in 2 arrays of integers.
member.param: A-version of the numbers (usually the old one)
B-version of the numbers (usually the new one)
member.returns: Returns a array of Items that describe the differences.

member.summary: This function converts all text lines of the text into unique numbers for every unique text line so further work can work only with simple numbers.
member.param: This extern initialized Hashtable is used for storing all ever used text lines.
ignore leading and trailing space characters

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.Sms(Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: This is the algorithm to find the Shortest Middle Snake (SMS).
member.param: lower bound of the actual range in DataA
upper bound of the actual range in DataA (exclusive)
lower bound of the actual range in DataB
upper bound of the actual range in DataB (exclusive)
a vector for the (0,0) to (x,y) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
a vector for the (u,v) to (N,M) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
member.returns: a MiddleSnakeData record containing x,y and u,v

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.Lcs(Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,Umbraco.Core.Strings.Diff.DiffData,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32[],System.Int32[])
member.summary: This is the divide-and-conquer implementation of the longest common-subsequence (LCS) algorithm. The published algorithm passes recursively parts of the A and B sequences. To avoid copying these arrays the lower and upper bounds are passed while the sequences stay constant.
member.param: lower bound of the actual range in DataA
upper bound of the actual range in DataA (exclusive)
lower bound of the actual range in DataB
upper bound of the actual range in DataB (exclusive)
a vector for the (0,0) to (x,y) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.
a vector for the (u,v) to (N,M) search. Passed as a parameter for speed reasons.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Utf8ToAsciiConverter
member.summary: Provides methods to convert Utf8 text to Ascii.

remarks.para: Tries to match characters such as accented eg "" to Ascii equivalent eg "e".
Converts all "whitespace" characters to a single whitespace.
Removes all non-Utf8 (unicode) characters, so in fact it can sort-of "convert" Unicode to Ascii.
Replaces symbols with '?'.

member.summary: Converts an Utf8 string into an array of Ascii characters.
member.param: The character to use to replace characters that cannot properly be converted.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Utf8ToAsciiConverter.ToAscii(System.Char[],System.Char[],System.Char)
member.summary: Converts an array of Utf8 characters into an array of Ascii characters.
member.param: The character to use to replace characters that cannot properly be converted.
member.returns: The number of characters in the output array.
member.remarks: The caller must ensure that the output array is big enough.
member.exception: The output array is not big enough.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Strings.Utf8ToAsciiConverter.ToAscii(System.Char[],System.Int32,System.Char[],System.Int32@,System.Char)
member.summary: Converts the character at position in input array of Utf8 characters and writes the converted value to output array of Ascii characters at position , and increments that position accordingly.
member.param: The character to use to replace characters that cannot properly be converted.

remarks.para: Adapted from various sources on the 'net including Lucene.Net.Analysis.ASCIIFoldingFilter.
Input should contain Utf8 characters exclusively and NOT Unicode.
Removes controls, normalizes whitespaces, replaces symbols by '?'.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Sync.ApplicationUrlHelper.ApplicationUrlProvider
member.summary: Gets or sets a custom provider for the umbraco application url.

Must return a properly formatted url with scheme and umbraco dir and no trailing slash eg "http://www.mysite.com/umbraco", or null. Must be assigned before resolution is frozen.

member.summary: Boots the messenger.

member.summary: Initializes a server that has never synchronized before.

member.summary: Synchronize the server (throttled).

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.ProcessDatabaseInstructions(Umbraco.Core.Persistence.IUmbracoDatabase)
member.summary: Process instructions from the database.
member.remarks: Thread safety: this is NOT thread safe. Because it is NOT meant to run multi-threaded.
member.returns: Returns the number of processed instructions

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.ProcessDatabaseInstructions(System.Collections.Generic.IReadOnlyCollection{Umbraco.Core.Sync.RefreshInstruction},Umbraco.Core.Persistence.Dtos.CacheInstructionDto,System.Collections.Generic.HashSet{Umbraco.Core.Sync.RefreshInstruction},System.Int32@)
member.summary: Processes the instruction batch and checks for errors
member.param: Tracks which instructions have already been processed to avoid duplicates
member.returns: returns true if all instructions in the batch were processed, otherwise false if they could not be due to the app being shut down

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.PruneOldInstructions(Umbraco.Core.Persistence.IUmbracoDatabase)
member.summary: Remove old instructions from the database
member.remarks: Always leave the last (most recent) record in the db table, this is so that not all instructions are removed which would cause the site to cold boot if there's been no instruction activity for more than DaysToRetainInstructions. See: http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-7643#comment=67-25085

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.EnsureInstructions(Umbraco.Core.Persistence.IUmbracoDatabase)
member.summary: Ensure that the last instruction that was processed is still in the database.
member.remarks: If the last instruction is not in the database anymore, then the messenger should not try to process any instructions, because some instructions might be lost, and it should instead cold-boot. However, if the last synced instruction id is '0' and there are '0' records, then this indicates that it's a fresh site and no user actions have taken place, in this circumstance we do not want to cold boot. See: http://issues.umbraco.org/issue/U4-8627

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.ReadLastSynced
member.summary: Reads the last-synced id from file into memory.
member.remarks: Thread safety: this is NOT thread safe. Because it is NOT meant to run multi-threaded.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.SaveLastSynced(System.Int32)
member.summary: Updates the in-memory last-synced id and persists it to file.
member.remarks: Thread safety: this is NOT thread safe. Because it is NOT meant to run multi-threaded.

member.name: F:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.LocalIdentity
member.summary: Gets the unique local identity of the executing AppDomain.

remarks.para: It is not only about the "server" (machine name and appDomainappId), but also about an AppDomain, within a Process, on that server - because two AppDomains running at the same time on the same server (eg during a restart) are, practically, a LB setup.
Practically, all we really need is the guid, the other infos are here for information and debugging purposes.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Sync.DatabaseServerMessenger.GetAllInstructions(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Newtonsoft.Json.Linq.JToken})
member.summary: Parses out the individual instructions to be processed

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.Sync.SingleServerRegistrar
member.summary: Can be used when Umbraco is definitely not operating in a Load Balanced scenario to micro-optimize some startup performance
member.remarks: The micro optimization is specifically to avoid a DB query just after the app starts up to determine the which by default is done with master election by a database query. The master election process doesn't occur until just after startup so this micro optimization doesn't really affect the primary startup phase.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.UdiRange
member.summary: Represents a range.

remarks.remarks: A Udi range is composed of a which represents the base of the range, plus a selector that can be "." (the Udi), ".*" (the Udi and its children), ".**" (the udi and its descendants, "*" (the children of the Udi), and "**" (the descendants of the Udi).
The Udi here can be a closed entity, or an open entity.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.UriExtensions
member.summary: Provides extension methods to .

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.UriExtensions.IsBackOfficeRequest(System.Uri,System.String,Umbraco.Core.Configuration.IGlobalSettings)
member.summary: Checks if the current uri is a back office request
member.param: The current application path or VirtualPath
member.remarks:
There are some special routes we need to check to properly determine this:
If any route has an extension in the path like .aspx = back office
These are def back office: /Umbraco/BackOffice = back office /Umbraco/Preview = back office If it's not any of the above, and there's no extension then we cannot determine if it's back office or front-end so we can only assume that it is not back office. This will occur if people use an UmbracoApiController for the backoffice but do not inherit from UmbracoAuthorizedApiController and do not use [IsBackOffice] attribute.
These are def front-end: /Umbraco/Surface = front-end /Umbraco/Api = front-end But if we've got this far we'll just have to assume it's front-end anyways.

member.name: T:Umbraco.Core.WriteLock
member.summary: Provides a convenience methodology for implementing locked access to resources.

remarks.para: Intended as an infrastructure class.

This is a very inefficient way to lock as it allocates one object each time we lock, so it's OK to use this class for things that happen once, where it is convenient, but not for performance-critical code!

member.summary: Provides the evaluation context for fast execution and custom variables resolution.
member.remarks:
This class is responsible for resolving variables during dynamic expression execution.
Discussed in http://weblogs.asp.net/cazzu/archive/2003/10/07/30888.aspx
Author: Daniel Cazzulino, blog

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.DynamicContext.AddVariable(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds the variable to the dynamic evaluation context.
member.param: The name of the variable to add to the context.
The value of the variable to add to the context.
member.remarks:
Value type conversion for XPath evaluation is as follows:
CLR Type XPath type
System.String XPathResultType.String
System.Double (or types that can be converted to) XPathResultType.Number
System.Boolean XPathResultType.Boolean
System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator XPathResultType.Navigator
System.Xml.XPath.XPathNodeIterator XPathResultType.NodeSet
Others XPathResultType.Any
See the topic "Compile, Select, Evaluate, and Matches with XPath and XPathExpressions" in MSDN documentation for additional information.
member.exception: The is null.

member.summary: Represents a content that can be navigated via XPath.

member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of the navigable content.
member.remarks: The root node identifier should be -1.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.INavigableContent.ParentId
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier of parent of the navigable content.
member.remarks: The top-level content parent identifiers should be -1 ie the identifier of the root node, whose parent identifier should in turn be -1.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.INavigableContent.Type
member.summary: Gets the type of the navigable content.

member.summary: Gets the unique identifiers of the children of the navigable content.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.INavigableContent.Value(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the value of a field of the navigable content for XPath navigation use.
member.returns: The value of the field for XPath navigation use.

remarks.para: Fields are attributes or elements depending on their relative index value compared to source.LastAttributeIndex.
For attributes, the value must be a string.

For elements, the value should an XPathNavigator instance if the field is xml and has content (is not empty), null to indicate that the element is empty, or a string which can be empty, whitespace... depending on what the data type wants to expose.

member.summary: Gets the name of the content type.

member.summary: Gets the field types of the content type.
member.remarks: This includes the attributes and the properties.

member.summary: Gets the name of the field type.

member.summary: Gets a method to convert the field value to a string.
member.remarks: This is for built-in properties, ie attributes. User-defined properties have their own way to convert their value for XPath.

member.returns: The content identified by the unique identifier, or null.
member.remarks: When id is -1 (root content) implementations should return null.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.INavigableSource.LastAttributeIndex
member.summary: Gets the index of the last attribute in the fields collections.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.INavigableSource.Root
member.summary: Gets the content at the root of the source.
member.remarks: That content should have unique identifier -1 and should not be gettable, ie Get(-1) should return null. Its ParentId should be -1. It should provide values for the attribute fields.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.MacroNavigator.Value
member.summary: Gets the string value of the item.
member.remarks: Does not fully behave as per the specs, as we report empty value on root and macro elements, and we start reporting values only on parameter elements. This is because, otherwise, we would might dump the whole database and it probably does not make sense at Umbraco level.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a content source, and an optional root content.
member.remarks: When no root content is supplied then the root of the source is used.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.#ctor(Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator,Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.State,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class as a clone.
member.remarks: Privately used for cloning a navigator.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.UnderlyingObject
member.summary: Gets the underlying content object.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.Clone
member.summary: Creates a new XPathNavigator positioned at the same node as this XPathNavigator.
member.returns: A new XPathNavigator positioned at the same node as this XPathNavigator.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.CloneWithNewRoot(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new XPathNavigator using the same source but positioned at a new root.
member.returns: A new XPathNavigator using the same source and positioned at a new root.
member.remarks: The new root can be above this navigator's root.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.CloneWithNewRoot(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new XPathNavigator using the same source but positioned at a new root.
member.returns: A new XPathNavigator using the same source and positioned at a new root.
member.remarks: The new root can be above this navigator's root.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.IsEmptyElement
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the current node is an empty element without an end element tag.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.IsSamePosition(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Determines whether the current XPathNavigator is at the same position as the specified XPathNavigator.
member.param: The XPathNavigator to compare to this XPathNavigator.
member.returns: true if the two XPathNavigator objects have the same position; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.Name
member.summary: Gets the qualified name of the current node.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.LocalName
member.summary: Gets the Name of the current node without any namespace prefix.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveTo(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNavigator)
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the same position as the specified XPathNavigator.
member.param: The XPathNavigator positioned on the node that you want to move to.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the same position as the specified XPathNavigator; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToFirstAttribute
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the first attribute of the current node.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the first attribute of the current node; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToFirstChild
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the first child node of the current node.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the first child node of the current node; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToFirstNamespace(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNamespaceScope)
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the first namespace node that matches the XPathNamespaceScope specified.
member.param: An XPathNamespaceScope value describing the namespace scope.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the first namespace node; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToNextNamespace(System.Xml.XPath.XPathNamespaceScope)
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the next namespace node matching the XPathNamespaceScope specified.
member.param: An XPathNamespaceScope value describing the namespace scope.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the next namespace node; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToId(System.String)
member.summary: Moves to the node that has an attribute of type ID whose value matches the specified String.
member.param: A String representing the ID value of the node to which you want to move.
member.returns: true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the navigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToNext
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the next sibling node of the current node.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToPrevious
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the previous sibling node of the current node.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToNextAttribute
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the next attribute.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the next attribute; false if there are no more attributes. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToParent
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the parent node of the current node.
member.returns: Returns true if the XPathNavigator is successful moving to the parent node of the current node; otherwise, false. If false, the position of the XPathNavigator is unchanged.

member.name: M:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.MoveToRoot
member.summary: Moves the XPathNavigator to the root node that the current node belongs to.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.BaseURI
member.summary: Gets the base URI for the current node.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.NameTable
member.summary: Gets the XmlNameTable of the XPathNavigator.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.NamespaceURI
member.summary: Gets the namespace URI of the current node.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.NodeType
member.summary: Gets the XPathNodeType of the current node.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.Prefix
member.summary: Gets the namespace prefix associated with the current node.

member.name: P:Umbraco.Core.Xml.XPath.NavigableNavigator.Value
member.summary: Gets the string value of the item.
member.remarks: Does not fully behave as per the specs, as we report empty value on content elements, and we start reporting values only on property elements. This is because, otherwise, we would dump the whole database and it probably does not make sense at Umbraco level.
